RACE.RACE_TEXT: FAIR GROUNDS RACE 1 1M Dirt CR: 73. Claiming Purse 15000. FOR ACCREDITED LA BRED FILLIES AND MARES FOUR YEARS OLD AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON FOUR RACES OR WHICH HAVE NOT WON TWO RACES OVER A MILE SINCE SEPTEMBER 16, 2022. Weight, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race At A Mile Or Over Since February 16 Allowed 3 lbs. Claiming Price $5,000 (Races Where Entered For $4,000 Or Less Not Considered In Eligibility And Allowances).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: SEE SASSY RUN rated far back in the three path, gained without urging in the two path around the far turn, produced a bold bid inside of the lugging leader leaving the three sixteenths pole, assumed command in upper stretch, and drew off well in hand. LACIS JEWEL trailed along the inside, awaited racing room while following the eventual winner's gain turning for home, fanned five wide in upper stretch after that foe got a jump, and rallied to gain place late. KEHRON'S CREED set the pace while a path of two off of the inner railing, required a tight left rein to keep from bearing outwardly down the backstretch and around the far turn, but drifted to the three to four paths while offering little resistance to an inner rival's bid in upper stretch, then was caught for place in the closing stages. MISSGREELEY'SSONG tucked behind the top flight to track along the inside around the first turn, saved ground around the far turn, but was outkicked by the eventual winner entering the lane, and lacked a bid. CAJUN SHOTS laid off of the pace in the two path, retreated to trail approaching the far turn, and passed tired rivals. STORIED TRIP stalked outside of the leader and from the three path, chased that foe around the far turn, but weakened nearing the lane, and was eased through the final furlong. BE A BANDIT tracked the top pair from the four path, but faded in the five path around the far turn.

ENTRY.NAME: Lacis Jewel
ENTRY.COMMENT: trailed ins, waited 1/4, 5wd upper, rallied, up place late

ENTRY.NAME: Storied Trip
ENTRY.COMMENT: stalked 2w-3p, chased 2nd, wknd, eased

ENTRY.NAME: Be a Bandit
ENTRY.COMMENT: tracked 3w-4p, faded 5p2nd

ENTRY.NAME: Kehron's Creed
ENTRY.COMMENT: speed off rail,kept from bearing out,bore 3-4p/nomatch upr,caught

ENTRY.NAME: Missgreeley'ssong
ENTRY.COMMENT: tracked inside, saved ground, outkicked 3/16, no bid

ENTRY.NAME: Cajun Shots
ENTRY.COMMENT: off pace ins-2p, trailed 3p2nd, passed tired

ENTRY.NAME: See Sassy Run
ENTRY.COMMENT: far back 3p, gained 2p2nd, bold ins bid 3/16, drew off, handily

RACE.RACE_TEXT: FAIR GROUNDS RACE 2 6F Dirt CR: 87. Starter Allowance Purse 20000. FOR FOUR YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE STARTED FOR A CLAIMING PRICE OF $5,000 OR LESS IN THEIR LAST THREE STARTS. Weight, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race At A Mile Or Over Since February 16 Allowed 3 lbs.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: CHARLI MICHAEL was the first onto the track, established the lead from the one post position, was able to draw away after the quarter pole. BOYFRIEND MATERIAL broke into the 2nd tier of horses, was bounced around a bit in between horses angled out and shuffled back stayed four wide through the turn, shifted out six wide at the quarter pole, was given clear racing room was asked, responded with a big turn of foot, closed extremely well and was able to get up for second. TWO DOT raced in the second tier from the four path early, advanced closer to the front and rated just off of he leaders hip, was asked at the quarter pole and responded but was caught late by an outside foe. INDIMAAJ was off a step slow, chased up the track from the four path, shifted down to the rail and saved ground as he advanced through the turn, was in contention at the quarter pole, made the turn and moved up the rail but ran flat in the las eighth of a mile. TAPPIN FORA DANCE was slow into stride, raced from the four path early, shifted into the three path, was brought out at the top of the lane but had no impact. COUNTER OFFER broke out to the left hitting the starting gate, and chased through out making no impact. BLUSHINSTREETDEVIL stalked from the second tier early, saved ground through the turn from in between horses, was within striking distance at the quarter pole, but stopped at the eighth pole.

ENTRY.NAME: Charli Michael
ENTRY.COMMENT: fastest out of the gate, lead from the rail, drew off

ENTRY.NAME: Blushinstreetdevil
ENTRY.COMMENT: 2nd tier early, stalked, saved ground, stopped

ENTRY.NAME: Counter Offer
ENTRY.COMMENT: broke out hitting the outside of the gates, and chased througout,

ENTRY.NAME: Boyfriend Material
ENTRY.COMMENT: 2nd tier, bounced around in between ,4w shuffled back, closed

ENTRY.NAME: Indimaaj
ENTRY.COMMENT: off slow, chased 4w early, saved ground turn, had no rally

ENTRY.NAME: Tappin Fora Dance
ENTRY.OWNER: Huff Ronnie Bone Danny and Booth Danny
ENTRY.COMMENT: off slow, raced 5w early, shifted into 3-4path, passed tired ones

ENTRY.NAME: Two Dot
ENTRY.COMMENT: stalked 4w, rated off the leaders hip, 3wuppr, closed, flattened

RACE.RACE_TEXT: FAIR GROUNDS RACE 3 1M Dirt CR: 68. Claiming Purse 15000. FOR ACCREDITED LA BRED THREE YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON THREE RACES. Three Year Olds, 117 lbs.; Older, 125 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race At A Mile Or Over Since February 16 Allowed 3 lbs. Claiming Price $5,000.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: BAND BOSS tracked two wide and between horses, gained an inside stalking position approaching the far turn, smoothly tipped outside of the leader entering the lane, bid and sparked a duel in upper stretch, battled through the final furlong, and narrowly prevailed. ITELLYOUTHEFACTS set the pace along the inside, dug in to resist BAND BOSS's bid in upper stretch, dueled gamely thereafter, but was bested. JUJU NINETEEN brushed the outer part of the gate while breaking a step slow, bumped an outer rival soon after, tracked four to three wide around the first turn, chased around the far turn, then failed to keep pace with the top two in upper stretch, yet held show while hanging on his left lead. HOPE FOR CHANGE stalked along the inside, but faded at the half mile pole, saved ground off of the pace around the far turn, yet kept on along the rail to surpass tired foes and regain a minor reward. ROCK STAR ALEX pressed outside of the leader, chased from between horses around the far turn, but yielded three wide entering the lane. TOTALLY ADDICTED laid off of the pace three to two wide and between horses, and failed to menace. FOOLISH DREAMS lunged out and bumped the outer part of the gate while off slow, lacked speed five to four wide around the first turn, came into the backstretch between horses, took the far turn in the three path, and failed to factor. MY HEAVY SON laid off of the pace along the inside, took the far turn in the four to five paths, shifted inwardly leaving the three sixteenths pole, and made no impact between horses. CHAPEL OF DREAMS stumbled leaving the gates, was awkward to regain balance while bumping with an inner rival soon after, raced far back while hung five wide, took the far turn in the four path, and tired while hanging on his left lead. SIR POKERFACE tossed his head while uncomfortable between horses approaching the first turn, lacked speed two wide and between horses, trailed in the five to six paths around the far turn and was outrun.

ENTRY.NAME: Hope for Change
ENTRY.COMMENT: stalked inside, faded 1/2, kept on, regained 4th

ENTRY.NAME: Itellyouthefacts
ENTRY.COMMENT: set pace inside, dug in upper, dueled, bested

ENTRY.NAME: Band Boss
ENTRY.COMMENT: tracked 2wd btwn,stalked ins 2nd,2w3/16,bid upr,dueled,prevailed

ENTRY.NAME: My Heavy Son
ENTRY.COMMENT: off pace ins, 4-5p2nd, shifted in upper, no impact btwn

ENTRY.NAME: Sir Pokerface
ENTRY.COMMENT: tossed head btwn into 1st, off pace 2wbtw, traild 5-6p2nd, outrun

ENTRY.NAME: Totally Addicted
ENTRY.COMMENT: off pace 3wd btwn, 2p2nd, no menace

ENTRY.NAME: Rock Star Alex
ENTRY.COMMENT: pressed 2wd, chased btwn 2nd, yielded 3w3/16

ENTRY.NAME: Juju Nineteen
ENTRY.COMMENT: brush gate/step slow/bump st,track 4-3w1st,chased 2nd,left lead

ENTRY.NAME: Chapel of Dreams
ENTRY.COMMENT: stumbled/bumped start, far back 5w, 4p2nd, tired, left lead

ENTRY.NAME: Foolish Dreams
ENTRY.COMMENT: lunged out/bumped gate/off slow,off pace 5-4w1st,3p2nd,no factor

RACE.RACE_TEXT: FAIR GROUNDS RACE 4 6F Dirt CR: 82. Starter Optional Claiming Purse 30000. FOR THREE YEAR OLDS WHICH HAVE STARTED FOR A CLAIMING PRICE OF $50,000 OR LESS AND WHICH HAVE NEVER WON A RACE OTHER THAN MAIDEN, CLAIMING OR CLAIMING PRICE $50,000. Weight, 122 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race Since February 16 Allowed 3 lbs. Claiming Price $5 0,000.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: MACHINE GUN MAN vied for the early lead, settled off the leaders hip form the three path within himself, briefly lost ground in the beginning of the turn and then was cued and made up that ground entering the stretch, during the stretch drive he was challenged by an inside foe, who he battled determinedly against and had and outside foe closing in close tot he wire but he raced gamely and got up for the win by a nose. DE SAIX vied for the early lead, set the pace from the rail, made a bold moving at the quarter pole by sneaking up the rail, challenging an outside foe, slightly brushed outward in the lane meeting his outside rival during the stretch battle, keep driving and racing until the wire. DE SAIX failed to switch leads but still raced a gutsy race and gave great effort even though he just missed today. MONEY RUN broke into the second tier along the inside, saved ground the entire trip from the two and three path, was in a good stalking position at the quarter pole, was closing but still behind the leaders at the eighth mile marker, angled out a bit was kept on point, and kept closing racing a close third. WESTERN COMMAND was in the 2nd tier of horses in the four path, raced wide, held that position and made no impact. F J'S FLACO was forced to check early as the horses moved out of the gates and gained position on the track, was shifted out wide but was never involved after that.

ENTRY.NAME: Money Run
ENTRY.COMMENT: inside trip, 2nd tier, angled out 1/8, closed dramatically,

ENTRY.NAME: De Saix
ENTRY.OWNER: Dantin Jr Daniel and Golden Rock Thoroughbreds
ENTRY.COMMENT: vied, pace from the rail,, slightly brushed foe in stretch, place

ENTRY.NAME: Western Command
ENTRY.OWNER: West Point Thoroughbreds Stephens Terry L and Stable 71
ENTRY.COMMENT: raced 3-4 w from off the pace and made no impact.

ENTRY.NAME: F J's Flaco
ENTRY.COMMENT: took back early, stayed wide, never involved

ENTRY.NAME: Machine Gun Man
ENTRY.COMMENT: vied, stalked, 3w, closed, battled, got up for the win.

RACE.RACE_TEXT: FAIR GROUNDS RACE 5 1M Turf CR: 93. Allowance Optional Claiming Purse 52000. FOR ACCREDITED LA BRED FOUR YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON TWO RACES OTHER THAN MAIDEN, CLAIMING, WAIVER CLAIMING OR STARTER OR WHICH HAVE NEVER WON THREE RACES OR CLAIMING PRICE $20,000. Weight, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of Two Races At A Mile Or O ver Since January 16 Allowed 2 lbs. Such A Race Since Then Allowed 4 lbs. Claiming Price $20,000. (If deemed inadvisable by management to run this race over the turf course, it will be run on the main track at One Mile and 70 Yards.) (Rail at 34 feet).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: DEER CROSSING settled off of the pace in the three path, pursued in the four path around the far turn, tipped five wide entering the lane, sustained a grinding charge to steadily inch closer to the leader in the final furlong, produced a bid in the late stages, and edged ahead. COFFEE COUNTY tracked in the two path, loomed a danger while aiming between the leading pair around the far turn, bid turning for home, gained an advantage at the quarter pole, drove clear approaching midstretch, but was worn down by an outer rival in the closing stages. PERRINS trailed in the three path, spun into the lane four wide, stayed on between horses to bid for show inside of MANGELSEN in the final furlong, and narrowly prevailed for that position. MANGELSEN prompted the pace while intentionally remaining in the six path for better footing in the center of the course tucked down to the four path while vying into the far turn, sparred with an inner bidder nearing the lane, but was headed by that one at the quarter pole, yielded between horses approaching midstretch, and lost show to an inner rival in the late stages. MAGA MAN stalked in the three path, chased from between horses around the far turn, but gave way nearing midstretch. BIND FAITH saved ground off of the pace, retreated to trail the field turning for home, altered course outwardly in upper stretch, and surpassed tired rivals. MR. FOUR SEVENS hopped at the start and was rank to recover, settled off of the pace in the two path, tugged between horses down the backstretch, but then tired through the lane. LAURI'S WISH set the pace along the inside, but was headed by a pair of outer rivals turning for home, and weakened through the lane.

ENTRY.NAME: Lauri's Wish
ENTRY.OWNER: Stewart, Chad J. and Lenci, Anthony
ENTRY.COMMENT: set pace inside, headed inside pair 5/16, wknd

ENTRY.NAME: Mangelsen
ENTRY.COMMENT: prompted 6p,vied 4p2nd,headed 1/4,yielded btwn upr,lost show late

ENTRY.NAME: Maga Man
ENTRY.COMMENT: stalked 3p, chased btwn 2nd, gave way

ENTRY.NAME: Bind Faith
ENTRY.COMMENT: off pace ins,saved ground,gave way 5/16,altered out,passed tired

ENTRY.NAME: Coffee County
ENTRY.COMMENT: tracked 2p, loomed btw 2nd, bid 5/16, led 1/4, cleared, worn down

ENTRY.NAME: Deer Crossing
ENTRY.COMMENT: off pace 3p, 4p2nd, 5w1/4, steady grind, late bid, edged ahead

ENTRY.NAME: Mr. Four Sevens
ENTRY.COMMENT: hopped/rank start, off pace 2p, tugged btw 5/8, tired

ENTRY.NAME: Perrins
ENTRY.OWNER: Dilschneider Adele B and Stall Nicole
ENTRY.COMMENT: trailed 3p, 4w1/4, stayed on btwn, show bid 1/8, prevailed

RACE.RACE_TEXT: FAIR GROUNDS RACE 6 6F Dirt CR: 91. Claiming Purse 28000. FOR ACCREDITED LA BRED FOUR YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON FOUR RACES OR WHICH HAVE NOT WON TWO RACES SINCE SEPTEMBER 16, 2022. Weight, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race Since February 16 Allowed 3 lbs. Claiming Price $25,000, if for $20,000, allo wed 2 lbs. (Races Where Entered For $15,000 Or Less Not Considered In Eligibility).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: WISE ANCHOR settled into a stalking position from the four path early on, was angled out a bit at the half mile pole where he started to gain ground, continued gaining ground and building momentum at the three eighths pole, was asked and responded gamely with a long consistent drive down the stretch, responding to every cue and willingly closing and gaining with every stride, he was able to take the lead at the eighth pole and was up for the win. CRYPTOZONIC was pinched back at the start as rivals from both sides broke into his path, was far of the pace early while saving ground along the rail, was able to find his stride and started coming on at he three eighths pole, was in contention at the five eighths pole, angled out at the quarter pole, responded to strong encouragement, down the lane while gaining ground on the eventual winner but had to settle for second as there was too much ground to make up today. FIERY PLAYBOY vied for the early lead from the five and six paths, matched strides with an inside foe for much of the early part of the race, shook the inside competitor in the turn, was on the lead at the quarter pole, shifted into the rail after the three sixteenth pole, and tired late. CREOLE CHARLIE vied for the early lead, matched strides early with an outside competitor down the back side, continued on the lead with the outside competitor until the five sixteenth pole, started to weaken a bit, but raced gamely near the end. BINDING AGREEMENT raced mid pack early on while staying wide, raced from the four and five paths, and made no impact in the stretch. WRONGWAYHIGHWAY was off slow, aced wide throughout and never got involved. YOUNG TUSCAN vied for the early lead from the rail position, settled back a bit through the turn was shifted out three wide into the stretch was within striking distance at the quarter pole, then faded late.

ENTRY.NAME: Young Tuscan
ENTRY.COMMENT: vied, stalked from the rail, 3-4w upper stretch, faded

ENTRY.NAME: Wise Anchor
ENTRY.COMMENT: stalked,3-4w, angled 4-5w,1/2, moved 3/8, long steady drive, game

ENTRY.NAME: Cryptozonic
ENTRY.COMMENT: pinched back, off pace, found his stride 3/8,shifted out 1/4

ENTRY.NAME: Binding Agreement
ENTRY.COMMENT: mid pack, outside, wide trip, never involved

ENTRY.NAME: Wrongwayhighway
ENTRY.COMMENT: off slow, raced wide, never got involved

ENTRY.NAME: Creole Charlie
ENTRY.COMMENT: vied, matched, chased

ENTRY.NAME: Fiery Playboy
ENTRY.COMMENT: vied, 5w, matched stride with inside foe, led 1/4, tired late

RACE.RACE_TEXT: FAIR GROUNDS RACE 7 6F Dirt CR: 69. Maiden Special Weight Purse 50000. FOR MAIDENS, FILLIES AND MARES THREE YEARS OLD AND UPWARD. Three Year Olds, 117 lbs.; Older, 125 lbs. (Preference To Horses That Have Not Started For Less Than $50,000 In Their Last 3 Starts).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: PEACOCK ALLEY stalked outside of the top pair, pressed within striking range around the turn, bid turning for home, dueled with an inner THE PRINCESS SAYS through upper stretch, wrestled an advantage at the furlong grounds, and drove clear in the final sixteeth. THE PRINCESS SAYS prompted the pace two wide, bid for the lead along with an outer PEACOCK ALLEY turning for home, sparred with that one while under confident handling in upper stretch, but was finally asked while getting headed at the furlong grounds, and proved no match for her outer counterpart in the final sixteenth. DIAL TONI broke a step slow, saved ground off of the pace, fanned to the five path in upper stretch, and stayed on to gain show late. CRIMALDI was held by the assistant starter when the gates opened and broke multiple lengths slow as a result, raced far back in the two path, improved inside of foes in upper stretch, and sustained stride to reach fourth at the wire. EXPECT A DANCER set the pace along the inside, met a pair of bids turning for home, got headed at the five sixteenths pole, and weakened through the lane. LADY HUXLEY pursued from midpack in the four to five paths around the turn, appeared to be easing under rider's restraint in upper stretch, yet shifted out before coming under mild coaxing in midstretch to surpass tiring rivals. TIME TO CLOSE tracked from midpack along the inside, but lugged out to the three to four paths around the turn, and tried. MARMO MOON bobbled while breaking outwardly and slowly at the start, trailed in the two path, and got outrun.

ENTRY.NAME: Dial Toni
ENTRY.OWNER: Wasabi Ventures Stables LLC and Franklin Ave Equine LLC
ENTRY.COMMENT: step slow start, off pace ins, saved ground, 5p upr, stayed on

ENTRY.NAME: Expect a Dancer
ENTRY.COMMENT: set pace ins, ins pair turn, headed 5/16, wknd

ENTRY.NAME: Time to Close
ENTRY.COMMENT: midpack ins, lug 3-4p turn, tired

ENTRY.NAME: The Princess Says
ENTRY.OWNER: JD Thoroughbreds LLC and Davis Joey Keith
ENTRY.COMMENT: prompt 2wd, bid btw 5/16, dueled ins, roused/headed 1/8, 2nd best

ENTRY.NAME: Peacock Alley
ENTRY.COMMENT: stalked 3wd, pressed turn, bid 5/16, dueled, led 1/8, cleared

ENTRY.NAME: Lady Huxley
ENTRY.COMMENT: midpack 4-5p, eased upper, asked 1/8, passed tired

ENTRY.NAME: Crimaldi
ENTRY.COMMENT: held start, off poorly, far back 2p, improved, up 4th

ENTRY.NAME: Marmo Moon
ENTRY.COMMENT: bobbled/slow start/broke out, trailed 2p, outrun

RACE.RACE_TEXT: FAIR GROUNDS RACE 8 5 1/2F Turf CR: 100. Allowance Optional Claiming Purse 52000. FOR FOUR YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON $13,000 TWICE OTHER THAN MAIDEN, CLAIMING, WAIVER CLAIMING, STARTER OR STATE BRED ALLOWANCE OR WHICH HAVE NEVER WON THREE RACES OR CLAIMING PRICE $50,000. Weight, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of Two Races Since J anuary 16 Allowed 2 lbs. A Race Since Then Allowed 4 lbs. Claiming Price $50,000 (Races Where Entered For $35,000 Or Less Not Considered In Allowances). (If deemed inadvisable by management to run this race over the turf course, it will be run on the main track at 5 and 1/2 Furlongs.) (Rail at 34 feet).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: ON YOUR MARK laid off of the pace in the four path, fanned to the eleven path in upper stretch, rallied to bid at the furlong grounds, sparred with an inner MINNESOTA READY thereafter, and prevailed. MINNESOTA READY settled off of the pace in the three path, rallied between horses in the five path in upper stretch, bid at the furlong grounds along with outer rivals, dueled with ON YOUR MARK through the closing stages but was bested. FORTUITY tracked in the four path, spun into upper stretch in the ten path while between horses, got outkicked by the eventual winner in midstretch, but offered a late rally in the closing stages, to gain show. ROBO dueled for the lead with an inner rival while taking the turn in the four path, shifted out to the six path entering the lane, but was outkicked by bidders on both sides at the furlong pole, and yielded. SKY AND SAND stalked along the inside while a path off of the rail, and chased in the three path through the lane while lacking a bid. SIMPLY WICKED dueled for the lead inside of a rival while a bit off of the rail, and gave way in midstretch. THERIDEOFALIFETIME chased in the three path while between horses around the turn, shifted out to the nine path in upper stretch, but faded. SUTHERLAND broke slowly while bobbling at the start, and trailed throughout.

ENTRY.NAME: Sky and Sand
ENTRY.OWNER: Reeves Thoroughbred Racing and Magnifico Stable
ENTRY.COMMENT: stalked ins-2p, 3p upr, chased, no bid

ENTRY.NAME: Minnesota Ready
ENTRY.COMMENT: off pace 3p, 5p1/4, rallied btwn, bid 1/8, dueled, bested

ENTRY.NAME: Fortuity
ENTRY.COMMENT: tracked 4p, 10p btw upr, outkicked 1/8, late rally, up show

ENTRY.NAME: Therideofalifetime
ENTRY.COMMENT: chased 3p btw, 9p upr, faded

ENTRY.NAME: Simply Wicked
ENTRY.COMMENT: dueled ins foe-2p, gave way 1/8

ENTRY.NAME: Sutherland
ENTRY.COMMENT: slow start/bobbled, trailed throughout

ENTRY.NAME: On Your Mark
ENTRY.OWNER: Andriot Steve Vanovich Steve and Cain Brad
ENTRY.COMMENT: off pace 4p,11p upr,rallied,bid/shifted in 1/8,dueled,prevailed

ENTRY.NAME: Robo
ENTRY.COMMENT: dueled 2wd-4p, 6p upr, yielded btwn 1/8

RACE.RACE_TEXT: FAIR GROUNDS RACE 9 5 1/2F Dirt CR: 57. Maiden Claiming Purse 15000. FOR ACCREDITED LA BRED MAIDENS, FILLIES THREE YEARS OLD. Weight, 120 lbs. Claiming Price $10,000.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: MADISON'S SCREEN vied two wide, led in the two path around the turn, drew off under driving pressure through upper stretch, flopped back to her left lead in the final furlong, and was wrapped up through the final sixteenth. CONTINENTAL RED took contact from an outer rival at the start, then steadied hard when put to tight rail quarters at the nine sixteenths pole, recovered to chase the leaders in the three to four paths around the turn, gained place at the three sixteenths pole after the leader kicked away, and stayed on to prove second best. GRACE'S SOLDIER broke slowly, saved ground far back, fanned to the six path entering the lane, and stayed on late to narrowly gain show at the wire. LOVE CREED checked subtly pursuing a troubled rival at the nine sixteenths pole, shifted out and gained in the six path around the turn, but flattened out in upper stretch without reaching contention, and was caught at the wire for show. PERIPHERAL VISION checked and shied outwardly while following a troubled rival leaving the nine sixteenths pole, raced off of the pace in the three path, and failed to menace. RUN AWAY SAMARI bobbled at the start, recovered to stalk outside of the top pair into the turn, pressed from the three path turning for home, but failed to keep pace entering the lane shifted inwardly in upper stretch, and weakened along the rail. DREAMED I AM FAST bumped an inner rival upon leaving the gates, vied along the inside, backed off to stalk entering the turn, altered course outside of a lugging foe at the three sixteenths pole, but lacked a bid thereafter. ALL AMERICAN PAT tracked four wide, but faded in the five path around the turn. AMYS CANDY was briefly put to tight quarters between a pair of rivals early on, and trailed thereafter.

ENTRY.NAME: Love Creed
ENTRY.COMMENT: light check 9/16, off pace, inched closer 6p turn, flattened out

ENTRY.NAME: Continental Red
ENTRY.OWNER: Sharp Cynthia A and Richards Corale A
ENTRY.COMMENT: bumped start,steadied hard 9/16,chased 3-4p,up place3/16,2nd best

ENTRY.NAME: Dreamed I Am Fast
ENTRY.OWNER: Bruno Jr Gerald Deville Carl J and Our Blue Streaks Stable
ENTRY.COMMENT: bump start, vied ins early, stalked 7/16, altered 2w3/16, no bid

ENTRY.NAME: Grace's Soldier
ENTRY.COMMENT: slow start,far back ins,saved ground,6p1/4,stayed on,just up show

ENTRY.NAME: Peripheral Vision
ENTRY.COMMENT: checked/shied 9/16, off pace 3p, no menace

ENTRY.NAME: Amys Candy
ENTRY.COMMENT: tight btwn early, trailed throughout

ENTRY.NAME: Run Away Samari
ENTRY.COMMENT: bobbled st,stalk 3w,pressd 2w-3p turn,outpaced 1/4,shiftd in,wknd

ENTRY.NAME: All American Pat
ENTRY.COMMENT: tracked 4wd, faded 5p turn

ENTRY.NAME: Madison's Screen
ENTRY.OWNER: Autumn Hill Farms Racing Stables, Inc.
ENTRY.COMMENT: vied 2wd,led 2p turn,drew off1/4,driving,flopped leads,wrapped up

WINNERS_DETAILS.BREEDER: Autumn Hill Farms Racing Stables, Inc.
